channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12918] Backport asciidoc changes
item.description:
For releases, we usually whole-sale copy the docs from master to the release branch, and do the release with the latest-in-time documentation.

With the asciidoc change, we cannot do that anymore unless we also get the pom.xml changes, etc.

Misty Stanley-Jones FYI.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Andrew Purtell, what do you think about this? Do we copy the docs from master for 0.98 releases?
Yes, I copy docs from master for 0.98 releases. What we can do is one big backport of docs from trunk to branch including the POM changes, and then resync at each release going forward.
I'm going to need to do this today to get the 0.98.10 RC out in time.

I'm going to need to do this today to get the 0.98.10 RC out in time.

Cool. 1.0.0RC2 will also benefit from this. Let me know if you need help.
Let me know if you guys need help with this. I didn't even think about it !
Thanks, I think I'm good. I have a working patch for 0.98 and am just testing one for branch-1.0 now.

Monster patches for 0.98 and branch-1.0 (and branch-1). I've confirmed these produce assemblies that have the all-in-one book. I think only the POM changes need review, and a sanity check of the output would be helpful.
You want to remove src/main/docbkx as well in these patches?

I think you need to remove all the docbkx stuff from the POMs too, and remove the src/main/site/docbkx directory. You also need to remove the XSLT transform to XML and add the one for Asciidoc, for hbase-default.xml.

I think you need to remove all the docbkx stuff from the POMs too, and remove the src/main/site/docbkx directory.

Done.

You also need to remove the XSLT transform to XML and add the one for Asciidoc, for hbase-default.xml.

This was done for 0.98 but not 1.0, fixed.

Testing the result.
Can you make a RB with your next round of patches?
There isn't time for RB I think. I'm spinning the new 0.98 RC in a couple of hours. I have just copied docs back from trunk EXCEPT the POM.
Here's what I have. Am having trouble testing the 0.98 changes because I'm running out of PermGen in assembly now. Adjusting MAVEN_OPTS and retrying...

Docs output for 0.98.10-SNAPSHOT here: http://people.apache.org/~apurtell/hbase-0.98.10-SNAPSHOT-docs.tar.gz

Testing branch-1.0 now.
+1 on the 0.98 docs. Do you care that the site (index.html) does not show Nick Dimiduk theme changes?

Do you care that the site (index.html) does not show Nick Dimiduk theme changes?

I think it's a minor issue but I can look at that now. I have to fix the branch-1.0 patch, I'm seeing this:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-site-plugin:3.4:site (default-site) on project hbase-annotations: Error generating maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.13:checkstyle: Failed during checkstyle execution: Unable to find configuration file at location: hbase/checkstyle.xml: Could not find resource 'hbase/checkstyle.xml'.

I reviewed the POM changes and earlier branch-1.0 history, the checkstyle problem pre-exists on branch-1 and master. I think the path to checkstyle.xml must be fully specified from the project root. It doesn't block 0.98 builds with site generation, so I'm going to proceed with looking at incorporating the theme changes. We might need to do more for branch-1, and I wonder if it's an issue on master.
Let me just fix the checkstyle.xml issue here
Oh yeah. You have to create an asciidoc/.gitignore in each submodule because I couldn't get asciidoc to stop trying to build docs for each submodule. You'll see it is that way in master.
Ok, thanks, let me make sure the patch for both branches have that.

No, this checkstyle problem is a blocker that I'm not able to make progress on. I've tried changing the path to it in the POM relative to $project.basedir but whether this is needs $project.basedir/hbase-checkstyle/... or $project.basedir/../hbase-checkstyle/... depends on phase. Copying the resources around doesn't help.

I get this:

[INFO] Generating "Checkstyle" report    --- maven-checkstyle-plugin:2.13

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Reactor Summary:

[INFO] 

[INFO] HBase .............................................. SUCCESS [08:28 min]

[INFO] HBase - Checkstyle ................................. SUCCESS [  1.271 s]

[INFO] HBase - Annotations ................................ FAILURE [  8.689 s]

[INFO] HBase - Common ..................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Protocol ................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Client ..................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Hadoop Compatibility ....................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Hadoop Two Compatibility ................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Prefix Tree ................................ SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Server ..................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Testing Util ............................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Thrift ..................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Rest ....................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Shell ...................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Integration Tests .......................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Examples ................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] HBase - Assembly ................................... SKIPPED

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD FAILURE

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 08:39 min

[INFO] Finished at: 2015-01-26T18:34:18-08:00

[INFO] Final Memory: 142M/1206M

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-site-plugin:3.3:site (default-site) on project hbase-annotations: Error during page generation: Error rendering Maven report: Failed during checkstyle execution: Unable to find configuration file at location: hbase/checkstyle.xml: Could not find resource 'hbase/checkstyle.xml'. -> [Help 1]

I wasted a whole day on this. I am just going to release 0.98.10 with docs copied back from master prior to the asciidoc changes and move this to 0.98.11.

I wasted a whole day on this. I am just going to release 0.98.10 with docs copied back from master prior to the asciidoc changes and move this to 0.98.11.

Let me take a stab at this tomorow. Was waiting for this for the 1.0.0RC2. If not I'll do the same.

Here is a branch-1 patch, which works for me doing: 


mvn install -DskipTests site assembly:single -Prelease

I've checked the book. It looks fine except for the logo, etc (I guess HBASE-12922) and it is missing the recent site changes.
Trying out the pom changes from the latest branch-1 patch in 0.98.
Attached what I am committing to 0.98, credited to Enis.
Thanks Andrew Purtell Enis Soztutar for cleaning up my mess. So sorry about the hassle.

Thanks Andrew. I also saw the checkstyle errors and some weird behavior with the site's styling in branch-1 and even in master. But I was not able to find the root cause of the problems. Maybe mvn does not clean properly when clean is run together with other commands or such.

Anyway, I've also pushed this and the subtask to to branch-1 and branch-1.0 as well. Resolving this.
Resolving. Hopefully all done. Thanks Andrew and Misty.
